text:
My mom was forced to just
get us out of a situation
that wasn't the safest

Education is really important
to me, and it is for my mom

I didn't know how
to ask for help

I just want other
poeple to have

a place where they can go
to and talk to each other

We are on the
edge of Skid Row

where poetry met
me, back in 2000

I'm here now, cuz this
fear now I say to myself

Is real now so
let's deal... NOW

What's up, how you guys doing?

in this community.

you need to sit down

get you some studio
time so that you could

be able to put out
your message and...

do what you feel
called and led to do so...

I came here to
acheive my success

was told I would be

street life distress

now I lay me down to sleep,
on this pillow of concrete
[Marcy] Everyone has a story,

and it motivated
me to keep going

We all need people like you
to do what you're doing

yeah, so I live in Koreatown
and I go to school all the
way in Northridge
because I didn't, um,

um, get my car it was very
difficult to, um, commute

what if I told you you
wouldn't have to worry
about that anymore?
It's for you

My Intentions are the same now
as they were... many years ago

my intention is to help kids who
are less fortunate

My intentions are to
raise awarenss for
former foster youths

What I intend to do...
is to give back

My name is Judy Vaughan
and I'm founding director
of Alexandria House

My intention
is to speak truth to power

to speak about the injustices
and the need for equity

[Justin] Thank you guys so much
for having us. Quavo and I,

it meant so much to
us just being here.
Thank you guys so much
